content.question: Which of the following processes will most likely have a negative <math alttext="delta S naught of reaction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><msubsup><mi>S</mi><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow><mtext>∘</mtext></msubsup></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="3 H 2, gas, plus N 2, gas, react to produce 2 N H 3, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mi>NH</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math>

<math alttext="H 2, gas, plus C l 2, gas, react to produce 2 H C l, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>Cl</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>HCl</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math>

<math alttext="H 2 O, solid, forms H 2 O, liquid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>→</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math>

<math alttext="2 O 3, gas, reacts to produce 3 O 2, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>→</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="3 H 2, gas, plus N 2, gas, react to produce 2 N H 3, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mi>NH</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math>

skill.text: 1.B: Describe the components of and quantitative information from models and representations that illustrate both particulate-level and macroscopic- level properties.
